snippet: In a small stand against gentrification, the nonprofit Wildflowers Institute has helped the gritty Tenderloin neighborhood define its cultural assets.
abstract: San Francisco nonprofit group Wildflowers Institute is aiding down-at-heels Tenderloin area in identifying its cultural assets; as stand against gentrification, more than 200 artists will be awarded certificates and other recognitions; dense 40-block neighborhood's historic residential hotels house 4,000 people, mostly single men.
lead_paragraph: In a small stand against gentrification, the nonprofit Wildflowers Institute has helped the gritty Tenderloin neighborhood define its cultural assets.

headline.main: As Wealth Changes the Tenderloin, a Move to Preserve Artistic ‘Gems’
headline.print_headline: As Wealth Changes the Tenderloin, a Move to Preserve Artistic ‘Gems’
